column4: what's the trick with getting flash to work in ff2.0 and edgy?
I apt-get dist-upgraded from dapper, and now every flash site kills firefox.
yes, I have flashplugin-nonfree, and I know that uninstalling it makes firefox not crash.
try adding this line to the end of /usr/bin/firefox:  export XLIB_SKIP_ARGB_VISUALS=1
does this actually work for some people? what is wrong with my system that I need an xlib param?

flash doesn't make firefox crash on my computer...i read before i even upgraded to edgy that the xlib line fixed the crashing...so i did it automatically, and don't even know if that's the solution...but it couldn't hurt for you to try it

also...you might want to try downloading the flashblock extension for firefox....if you've got a buncha tabs open with flash movies, or ads, or whatever...it stops all of them until you grant each one permission to play with the click of a button
overall, i'm happy with the improvements in edgy...seems like all the packages i need are up to date and pretty damn stable...and i definitely enjoy shaving 25~30 sec off every boot
I wish it had been so nice for me.
i prolly would have stuck with dapper, but i wanted mythtv 0.20...and it was in the edgy repository for, so it was a no-brainer....and i've definitely never dist-upgraded and prolly never will
yeah, I should have known, I normally just backup /home and reinstall
yeah, and I do, but it doesn't give you any of the new desktop tweaks :)
by tweaks do you mean compiz?
I don't know what compiz is, but any of the default desktop settings.
if you want default desktop settings...you can just delete all your the ".*" (or hidden) files in your /home dir
